title: American_Top_40_1972_February_19th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

Someone writes in to ask, "Has a record ever dropped from number one, right out of the top ten?" Casey says it has happened only once, and the act it happened to is in this countdown.

There is a hit by the guitar player from Detroit who played on eleven different songs in the top 40 in June of 1972.

A listener wants to know, "What rock and roll act stayed at number one on the album chart the most weeks in a row?"

Casey answers the question, "Has there ever been a song that was number one on the pop chart, the soul chart, and the country & western chart, all at the same time?" The answer is yes, but only once.
